7.24.17  3:58 pm   Hey bill, thank you for answering my question. Your response made me seriously think about my current situation. At this point I am 20 and there is so much I want to prove, I want to grow beyond measures and make an impact in the animation industry (my life goal). I know I must resolve myself to this goal. Do you feel like you have to choose? Between a relationship with someone or working in solitude. I haven't received an assault of questions of when I am going to get married or settle down yet but I know in the few years I will. It's a suffocating feeling. I hope this isn't intrusive but did you go through something similar and what are you thoughts?

     'cause I do, and it feels nice to have a support network of individuals with similar experiences. :)

7.24.17  6:23 am   hey Bill, it's winter in Australia where I live rn. I was thinking that people should invent a machine to teleport users back and forth from an uncomfortably cold location to an uncomfortably  hot location so that the two opposites could cancel each other out. Saves a lot on heating and cooling devices that way.

     But then I realised that people would get plenty nauseous and their ability to function would tank to 0% efficiency so I figured I should stop thinking about such futile inventions and work on some homework instead. What do you think about such a machine?

7.24.17  3:44 am   What do you think about human kind?
7.24.17  3:29 am   So I've noticed you're updating reality again, but you're doing it pretty slowly. Is there a specific schedule for reality updates or are you just doing them whenever?

7.24.17  1:10 am   what did you think about when you first started doing the reality videos?

     Were they already reality videos or were they just videos?
7.24.17  1:08 am   you can get feedback from videos in the comment section on youtube. but how do you get feedback on the no-video songs, besides emailing and the questions page?

7.23.17  11:50 pm   Do you ever feel boxed in by your audience's expectations?

     For example, do you keep making videos purely because that's what you love doing, or is it at least partially because you're now "that guy who makes videos"?

     I'm mainly curious if you've ever considered giving up YouTube to pursue making full-length music albums.

7.23.17  11:49 pm   You've said a few times that you've been playing music from a young age and you're very confident in your abilities (which you should be!). Do you ever feel or give into the temptation to "show off" in your music-whether it's a fast run, fancy chord, highly technical progression, vocal trick, or whatever

     -or do you simply put those things in when they feel "right" to you?

7.23.17  4:27 pm   What's something that you think we oughta know?

7.23.17  4:24 pm   Do you think if you play enough songs in odd time signatures (5/4, 7/8, etc) that those will eventually start to feel "natural"? I know the ear/brain probably feels the most at ease when the rhythm of the song stays grouped in beats of 2,3 or 4 from start to finish. Though, can't you break down complex time signatures into combined groupings of simple beats?
